t: John 13
Jesus Washes the Disciples’ Feet

Now*p before the Feast of the Passover, when Jesus knew that His hour had come that He should depart from this world to the Father, having loved His own who were in the world, He loved them to the end.
And*p supper being ended, the devil having already put it into the heart of Judas Iscariot, Simon’s son,*i to betray Him,
Jesus, knowing that the Father had given all things into His hands, and that He had come from God and was going to God,
rose from supper and laid aside His garments, took a towel and girded Himself.
After that, He poured water into a basin and began to wash the disciples’ feet, and to wipe them*i with the towel with which He was girded.
Then He came to Simon Peter. And Peter*i said to Him, “Lord, are You washing my feet?”
Jesus*p answered and said to him, “What*r I*r am*r doing*r you*r do*r not*r understand*r now,*r but*r you*r will*r know*r after*r this.”*r
Peter*p said to Him, “You shall never wash my feet!” Jesus*p answered him, “If*r I*r do*r not*r wash*r you,*r you*r have*r no*r part*r with*r Me.”*r
Simon*p Peter said to Him, “Lord, not my feet only, but also my*i hands and my*i head!”
Jesus*p said to him, “He*r who*r is*r bathed*r needs*r only*r to*r wash*r his*ir feet,*r but*r is*r completely*r clean;*r and*r you*r are*r clean,*r but*r not*r all*r of*r you.”*r
For He knew who would betray Him; therefore He said, “You*r are*r not*r all*r clean.”*r
So*p when He had washed their feet, taken His garments, and sat down again, He said to them, “Do*r you*r know*r what*r I*r have*r done*r to*r you?*r
You*r call*r Me*r Teacher*r and*r Lord,*r and*r you*r say*r well,*r for*r so*ir I*r am.*r
If*r I*r then,*r your*ir Lord*r and*r Teacher,*r have*r washed*r your*r feet,*r you*r also*r ought*r to*r wash*r one*r another’s*r feet.*r
For*r I*r have*r given*r you*r an*r example,*r that*r you*r should*r do*r as*r I*r have*r done*r to*r you.*r
Most*r assuredly,*r I*r say*r to*r you,*r a*r servant*r is*r not*r greater*r than*r his*r master;*r nor*r is*r he*r who*r is*r sent*r greater*r than*r he*r who*r sent*r him.*r
If*r you*r know*r these*r things,*r blessed*r are*r you*r if*r you*r do*r them.*r
Jesus Identifies His Betrayer

“I*rp do*r not*r speak*r concerning*r all*r of*r you.*r I*r know*r whom*r I*r have*r chosen;*r but*r that*r the*r Scripture*r may*r be*r fulfilled,*r ‘He*r who*r eats*r bread*r with*r Me*r has*r lifted*r up*r his*r heel*r against*r Me.’*r
Now*r I*r tell*r you*r before*r it*r comes,*r that*r when*r it*r does*r come*r to*r pass,*r you*r may*r believe*r that*r I*r am*r He.*ir
Most*r assuredly,*r I*r say*r to*r you,*r he*r who*r receives*r whomever*r I*r send*r receives*r Me;*r and*r he*r who*r receives*r Me*r receives*r Him*r who*r sent*r Me.”*r
When*p Jesus had said these things, He was troubled in spirit, and testified and said, “Most*r assuredly,*r I*r say*r to*r you,*r one*r of*r you*r will*r betray*r Me.”*r
Then the disciples looked at one another, perplexed about whom He spoke.
Now*p there was leaning on Jesus’ bosom one of His disciples, whom Jesus loved.
Simon Peter therefore motioned to him to ask who it was of whom He spoke.
Then,*p leaning back on Jesus’ breast, he said to Him, “Lord, who is it?”

Jesus*p answered, “It*r is*r he*r to*r whom*r I*r shall*r give*r a*r piece*r of*r bread*r when*r I*r have*r dipped*r it.”*ir And having dipped the bread, He gave it*i to Judas Iscariot, the*i son*i of Simon.
Now after the piece of bread, Satan entered him. Then Jesus said to him, “What*r you*r do,*r do*r quickly.”*r
But no one at the table knew for what reason He said this to him.
For some thought, because Judas had the money box, that Jesus had said to him, “Buy those*i things*i we need for the feast,” or that he should give something to the poor.
Having*p received the piece of bread, he then went out immediately. And it was night.
The New Commandment
So,*p when he had gone out, Jesus said, “Now*r the*r Son*r of*r Man*r is*r glorified,*r and*r God*r is*r glorified*r in*r Him.*r
If*r God*r is*r glorified*r in*r Him,*r God*r will*r also*r glorify*r Him*r in*r Himself,*r and*r glorify*r Him*r immediately.*r

Little*r children,*r I*r shall*r be*r with*r you*r a*r little*r while*r longer.*r You*r will*r seek*r Me;*r and*r as*r I*r said*r to*r the*r Jews,*r ‘Where*r I*r am*r going,*r you*r cannot*r come,’*r so*r now*r I*r say*r to*r you.*r
A*r new*r commandment*r I*r give*r to*r you,*r that*r you*r love*r one*r another;*r as*r I*r have*r loved*r you,*r that*r you*r also*r love*r one*r another.*r
By*r this*r all*r will*r know*r that*r you*r are*r My*r disciples,*r if*r you*r have*r love*r for*r one*r another.”*r
Jesus Predicts Peter’s Denial
Simon*p Peter said to Him, “Lord, where are You going?” Jesus*p answered him, “Where*r I*r am*r going*r you*r cannot*r follow*r Me*r now,*r but*r you*r shall*r follow*r Me*r afterward.”*r
Peter*p said to Him, “Lord, why can I not follow You now? I will lay down my life for Your sake.”

Jesus*p answered him, “Will*r you*r lay*r down*r your*r life*r for*r My*r sake?*r Most*r assuredly,*r I*r say*r to*r you,*r the*r rooster*r shall*r not*r crow*r till*r you*r have*r denied*r Me*r three*r times.*r
